intro: Drossera, commonly known as ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Onagraceae. Drossera species are typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. They produce capsules as their fruit, which contain numerous tiny seeds. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique floral displays.
